thread.title: A New Role For Hospitals: Boosting the Local Economy

author: Kate King
title: A New Role For Hospitals: Boosting the Local Economy
text:
NEWARK, N.J.â€”At the Rock Ya Sock warehouse here, three large machines churn out yellow, gray, blue and white hospital socks for patients at Newark Beth Israel Medical Center, a 665-bed hospital that treats a population struggling with high poverty and unemployment.

The hospital switched to a local sock vendor in late 2016 as part of a recent push by RWJBarnabas Health, one of the largest hospital systems in New Jersey and owner of Newark Beth Israel, to tackle economic issues that contribute to health problems, according to...
